page.title: 07Llandudno:Shopping Centre(1)
page.content: During May 1985,{150 people were {interviewed at random on Mostyn {Street,}the main street of the town. It was found that 52% lived locally and the remainder were either visiting the town or on holiday. Of the second category, 85% came by car, while the remaining 15% used public transport. 48% said they were in Mostyn street to shop. Other reasons given were: business, work, holiday. Asked what they bought, over 90% of the shoppers said: food, clothes or both. The most popular single shop named was Marks and Spencer (by 60%). Second came Asda Stores (by 20% of shoppers). No other single shop was named by a large enough number of shoppers to be of significance. (continued on p.8)
